<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/02/health-officials-say-vulnerable-americans-may-need-vaccine-booster-shots?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When That Booster Shot Hits
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Dragon Ball Z" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/FRkBbAdRf2jTfahZaA/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Dragon Ball Z" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/FRkBbAdRf2jTfahZaA/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With the highly contagious Delta variant spreading across the globe, more countries are making plans to offer vulnerable residents an extra layer of vaccine protection. Germany said yesterday it would offer Covid-19 booster shots to older people and those with underlying health conditions starting in September. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Other governments have made similar moves:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Israel</strong></span><span> began giving a booster shot to people over 60 this past weekend. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Britain</strong></span><span> will begin offering a booster of a Covid vaccine starting in September, the Telegraph reported.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Bahrain </strong></span><span>is giving Pfizer boosters to some people who </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/bahrain-middle-east-coronavirus-vaccine-coronavirus-pandemic-health-2d4b5c26b1480f1fd0d7e3a9e9a62d0e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">received</a></span><span> China’s Sinopharm vaccine.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What about the US?  </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There's no clear roadmap, but momentum is building to offer some Americans a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/23/us/covid-vaccine-boosters.html?partner=slack&smid=sl-share" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">booster shot</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Dr. Amanda Cohn of the CDC’s immunization division said that officials were “actively looking into ways” to give people access to booster shots “earlier than any potential regulatory decisions.” </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Former FDA chief Scott Gottlieb told CNBC, “My guess is sometime by September or October we will be giving booster shots to older individuals and certainly immunocompromised.” We should note: Gottlieb is on the Pfizer board.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Is there any evidence that they're needed? </strong>Pfizer and BioNTech <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/28/health/pfizer-booster-shots.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> a study (not yet peer-reviewed) that showed their vaccine’s effectiveness drops from 95% to 84% after about six months. Pfizer suggested a third shot would help bolster immunity in vulnerable populations as the Delta variant spreads.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some experts aren't convinced. “I would say right now, there is not evidence that we need to go ahead with boosters in the United States, but that’s an ongoing debate,” NIH Director Dr. Francis Collins said on </span><span><em>GMA</em></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One</strong> <strong style="color:#000">thing is<em> </em>clear: </strong>There's a lot of $$$ in boosters. Pfizer forecasted <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/28/pfizer-expects-covid-vaccine-bring-335-billion-year?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$33.5 billion</a> in Covid vaccine sales this year, a 29% bump from previous estimates, in anticipation of selling a third dose. It plans to ask for regulatory approval in the US for a booster shot this month. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> When asked about the need for boosters, the medical community repeatedly offers up a big shrug. But given concerns about decreasing vaccine effectiveness against Delta, it sure looks like they may make an appearance for certain populations in the US by the fall. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BANKING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/02/goldman-sachs-latest-wall-street-bank-bump-firstyear-analyst-pay?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Every Investment Bank Right Now
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/02/goldman-sachs-latest-wall-street-bank-bump-firstyear-analyst-pay?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt='Meredith Grey saying "So pick me. Choose me. Love me."' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MDMzL2Nob29zZV9tZS5qcGVnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Grey's Anatomy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Peer pressure works. Goldman Sachs joined other Wall Street banks and <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/02/goldman-sachs-joins-wall-street-rivals-in-boosting-junior-banker-salaries-.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bumped</a> the salary for its first-year analysts to $110k, an increase of nearly 30%. The move comes weeks after Morgan Stanley and JPMorgan also boosted starting salaries to $100k for junior analysts.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> In March, an <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/18/spacs-post-record-q1-exceed-2020-dealmaking-total?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">internal survey</a> of Goldman analysts revealed they worked 100-hour weeks in a pressure cooker environment. Those young employees warned there was only a 35% chance they’d continue at the firm longer than six months unless working conditions improved.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>CEO David Solomon responded by saying the bank would hire more analysts, automate what could be automated, and enforce a no-work-on-Saturdays rule.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But as other banks hiked salaries and offered perks like free Pelotons, Goldman felt like it had no choice but to one-up its rivals.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Like in many industries, investment banking firms are desperate to fill open roles and, as a result, have raised salaries. Your friends graduating from business school are finding themselves at the center of a very lucrative bidding war.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/02/infrastructure-bill-need-know?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Infrastructure Bill: What You Need to Know
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Bridge in Virginia" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81Mjk3L2JyaWRnZV9pbl92aXJnaW5pYS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Drew Angerer/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">America’s infrastructure system, which <a href="https://infrastructurereportcard.org/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scored a C-</a> this year, is going to summer school. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Senate is expected to pass an infrastructure bill this week that will provide a much-needed upgrade to the US’ bumpy roads, glitchy internet, and 100-year-old water pipes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">By the numbers</strong>: The deal calls for more than $550 billion in new spending, including…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$110 billion for roads and bridges </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$73 billion to modernize the nation’s energy grid</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$66 billion for rail and Amtrak </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$65 billion for broadband expansion </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span> $55 billion to improve the country’s drinking water</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span> $39 billion for transit</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Virtually no part of the US economy is untouched by the plan. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said it’s been decades since Congress passed “such a significant, stand-alone investment.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who’s paying for it? Is a tax hike on the horizon? </strong>Nope. The White House said the money will come from reclaiming unused Covid aid funds, collecting unpaid taxes on cryptocurrency investments, and selling billions of dollars worth of oil from reserves.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Corporate <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-02/the-winners-and-losers-in-the-bipartisan-infrastructure-bill?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">winners</a> include Amazon, FedEx, UPS, and airlines, while losers are the crypto industry and electric vehicle companies, which received significantly less funding than initial plans showed.</p>

</a><span>  </span>

</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/02/key-performance-indicators-august-3?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Lord of the Rings still from Amazon" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MDI2L2xvcmRfb2ZfdGhlX3JpbmdzX2FtYXpvbi5qcGVnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Amazon Studios</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>After years of speculation, Amazon’s <em>Lord of the Rings </em>TV series finally has a <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/lord-of-the-rings-release-date-photo-1234991590/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">release date</a>—September 2, 2022, just in time for the Theta wave. With a first season that will cost $465 million, it’s the most expensive television show of all time.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quot</strong><strong style="color:#000">e:</strong> “I am very glad I was vaccinated because without vaccination I am certain I would not feel as well as I do now.”<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sen. Lindsey Graham, a Republican from South Carolina, revealed that he <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2021/08/02/lindsey-graham-covid-19-breakthrough-infection/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tested positive</a> for Covid-19 despite being fully vaccinated. Graham is the first “breakthrough” case in the Senate.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Who actually gets to create Black pop culture? (<a href="https://www.currentaffairs.org/2021/07/who-actually-gets-to-create-black-pop-culture?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Current Affairs</a>) </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/02/blackstonebacked-firm-buy-reese-witherspoons-media-company?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hello Black Sunstone
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/02/blackstonebacked-firm-buy-reese-witherspoons-media-company?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="NEW YORK, NY - NOVEMBER 28:  Actress and Founder of Hello Sunshine Reese Witherspoon" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MDM1L2F0X3RfY2VsZWJyYXRlc190aGVfbGF1bmNoX29mX2hlbGxvX3N1bnNoaW5lLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Dave Kotinsky/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Reese Witherspoon’s production company, Hello Sunshine, has been <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/business/business-news/reese-witherspoon-hello-sunshine-sale-1234978326/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sold</a> for an estimated $900 million to a new, unnamed media firm with lots of big names attached to it. Two former Disney execs, Kevin Mayer and Tom Staggs, are the fearless leaders, and it’s backed by private equity giant Blackstone. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Their goal: scoop up smaller, high-quality content companies like Witherspoon’s and monetize through distribution partnerships and commerce. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Reese Witherspoon, the only actress with the range to play both Elle Woods and June Carter Cash, founded Hello Sunshine in 2016, and went on to produce some mega TV hits like <em>Little Fires Everywhere</em>, <em>The Morning Show</em>, and <em>Big Little Lies</em>. Witherspoon <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/reese-witherspoons-hello-sunshine-to-be-sold-to-media-company-backed-by-blackstone-11627914600?mod=hp_lead_pos2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told</a> the WSJ that her company's success shows that viewers crave more stories centered on women. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Blackstone is bankrolling the media venture with $2 billion, so Mayer and Staggs are on the hunt for other acquisitions. One potential target: LeBron James and Maverick Carter's SpringHill production company. </p>

<tr>

extra layer of vaccine protection. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOther governments have made similar moves:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIsrael\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e began giving a booster shot to people over 60 this past weekend. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBritain\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e will begin offering a booster of a Covid vaccine starting in September, the Telegraph reported.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBahrain \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eis giving Pfizer boosters to some people who \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/bahrain-middle-east-coronavirus-vaccine-coronavirus-pandemic-health-2d4b5c26b1480f1fd0d7e3a9e9a62d0e?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereceived\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e China’s Sinopharm vaccine.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat about the US?  \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere's no clear roadmap, but momentum is building to offer some Americans a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/23/us/covid-vaccine-boosters.html?partner=slack\u0026smid=sl-share\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebooster shot\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDr. Amanda Cohn of the CDC’s immunization division said that officials were “actively looking into ways” to give people access to booster shots “earlier than any potential regulatory decisions.” \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFormer FDA chief Scott Gottlieb told CNBC, “My guess is sometime by September or October we will be giving booster shots to older individuals and certainly immunocompromised.” We should note: Gottlieb is on the Pfizer board.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIs there any evidence that they're needed? \u003c/strong\u003ePfizer and BioNTech \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/28/health/pfizer-booster-shots.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e a study (not yet peer-reviewed) that showed their vaccine’s effectiveness drops from 95% to 84% after about six months. Pfizer suggested a third shot would help bolster immunity in vulnerable populations as the Delta variant spreads.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSome experts aren't convinced. “I would say right now, there is not evidence that we need to go ahead with boosters in the United States, but that’s an ongoing debate,” NIH Director Dr. Francis Collins said on \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eGMA\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ething is\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003eclear: \u003c/strong\u003eThere's a lot of $$$ in boosters. Pfizer forecasted \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/28/pfizer-expects-covid-vaccine-bring-335-billion-year?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$33.5 billion\u003c/a\u003e in Covid vaccine sales this year, a 29% bump from previous estimates, in anticipation of selling a third dose. It plans to ask for regulatory approval in the US for a booster shot this month. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e When asked about the need for boosters, the medical community repeatedly offers up a big shrug. But given concerns about decreasing vaccine effectiveness against Delta, it sure looks like they may make an appearance for certain populations in the US by the fall. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL Goldman Sachs joined other Wall Street banks and \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/02/goldman-sachs-joins-wall-street-rivals-in-boosting-junior-banker-salaries-.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebumped\u003c/a\u003e the salary for its first-year analysts to $110k, an increase of nearly 30%. The move comes weeks after Morgan Stanley and JPMorgan also boosted starting salaries to $100k for junior analysts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e In March, an \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/18/spacs-post-record-q1-exceed-2020-dealmaking-total?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einternal survey\u003c/a\u003e of Goldman analysts revealed they worked 100-hour weeks in a pressure cooker environment. Those young employees warned there was only a 35% chance they’d continue at the firm longer than six months unless working conditions improved.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCEO David Solomon responded by saying the bank would hire more analysts, automate what could be automated, and enforce a no-work-on-Saturdays rule.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut as other banks hiked salaries and offered perks like free Pelotons, Goldman felt like it had no choice but to one-up its rivals.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Like in many industries, investment banking firms are desperate to fill open roles and, as a result, have raised salaries. Your friends graduating from business school are finding themselves at the center of a very lucrative bidding war.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmerica’s infrastructure system, which \u003ca href=\"https://infrastructurereportcard.org/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003escored a C-\u003c/a\u003e this year, is going to summer school. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Senate is expected to pass an infrastructure bill this week that will provide a much-needed upgrade to the US’ bumpy roads, glitchy internet, and 100-year-old water pipes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBy the numbers\u003c/strong\u003e: The deal calls for more than $550 billion in new spending, including…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$110 billion for roads and bridges \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$73 billion to modernize the nation’s energy grid\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$66 billion for rail and Amtrak \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$65 billion for broadband expansion \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e $55 billion to improve the country’s drinking water\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e $39 billion for transit\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eVirtually no part of the US economy is untouched by the plan. Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said it’s been decades since Congress passed “such a significant, stand-alone investment.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho’s paying for it? Is a tax hike on the horizon? \u003c/strong\u003eNope. The White House said the money will come from reclaiming unused Covid aid funds, collecting unpaid taxes on cryptocurrency investments, and selling billions of dollars worth of oil from reserves.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eCorporate \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-02/the-winners-and-losers-in-the-bipartisan-infrastructure-bill?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewinners\u003c/a\u003e include Amazon, FedEx, UPS, and airlines, while losers are the crypto industry and electric vehicle companies, which received significantly less funding than initial plans showed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" Sunshine, has been \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/business/business-news/reese-witherspoon-hello-sunshine-sale-1234978326/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esold\u003c/a\u003e for an estimated $900 million to a new, unnamed media firm with lots of big names attached to it. Two former Disney execs, Kevin Mayer and Tom Staggs, are the fearless leaders, and it’s backed by private equity giant Blackstone. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTheir goal: scoop up smaller, high-quality content companies like Witherspoon’s and monetize through distribution partnerships and commerce. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eReese Witherspoon, the only actress with the range to play both Elle Woods and June Carter Cash, founded Hello Sunshine in 2016, and went on to produce some mega TV hits like \u003cem\u003eLittle Fires Everywhere\u003c/em\u003e, \u003cem\u003eThe Morning Show\u003c/em\u003e, and \u003cem\u003eBig Little Lies\u003c/em\u003e. Witherspoon \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/reese-witherspoons-hello-sunshine-to-be-sold-to-media-company-backed-by-blackstone-11627914600?mod=hp_lead_pos2\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold\u003c/a\u003e the WSJ that her company's success shows that viewers crave more stories centered on women. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eBlackstone is bankrolling the media venture with $2 billion, so Mayer and Staggs are on the hunt for other acquisitions.
